channel.title: DNS on Master of Software Engineering
channel.description: Recent content in DNS on Master of Software Engineering

item.title: DNS record types
item.description: In this blog post I will briefly explain some of the most common DNS record types. A (address) record: always points to a static IP address. AAAA record: the same as the A type record, but for IPv6 IP addresses. CNAME (canonical name) record: alias to another name (=domain), which can be an A record or another CNAME record. The only exception is that you cannot create a CNAME record in the zone apex (the root of your domain).
